Wisdom: الظَّنُّ ارْتِيَابٌ
enWisdom: Conjecture is suspicion

Wisdom: الرِّيبَةُ تُوجِبُ الظِّنَّةَ
enWisdom: Suspicion leads to mistrust

Wisdom: الرَّجُلُ السُّوءُ لَا يَظُنُّ بِأَحَدٍ خَيْراً لِأَنَّهُ لَا يَرَاهُ إِلَّا بِوَصْفِ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: The evil man does not think positively about anyone because he does not see anyone but through the depiction of his own soul

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُسِي‏ءَ الظَّنَّ فَإِنَّ سُوءَ الظَّنِّ يُفْسِدُ الْعِبَادَةَ وَيُعَظِّمُ الْوِزْرَ
enWisdom: Be careful not to think negatively, for indeed thinking ill of others corrupts worship and increases the burden [of sin]

Wisdom: آفَةُ الدِّينِ سُوءُ الظَّنِّ
enWisdom: The bane of religion is thinking ill [of others]

Wisdom: إِذَا اسْتَوْلَى الصَّلَاحُ عَلَى الزَّمَانِ وَأَهْلِهِ ثُمَّ أَسَاءَ الظَّنَّ رَجُلٌ بِرَجُلٍ لَمْ يَظْهَرْ مِنْهُ خِزْيَةٌ فَقَدْ ظَلَمَ وَاعْتَدَى
enWisdom: In an age when righteousness prevails over a people, if a person entertains an evil suspicion about another person from whom no evil has become evident, then he has been unjust and has transgressed

Wisdom: سُوءُ الظَّنِّ يُفْسِدُ الْأُمُورَ وَيَبْعَثُ عَلَى الشُّرُورِ
enWisdom: Thinking ill corrupts matters and incites one to evils

Wisdom: سُوءُ الظَّنِّ بِالْمُحْسِنِ شَرُّ الْإِثْمِ وَأَقْبَحُ الظُّلْمِ
enWisdom: Thinking ill of a virtuous person is the gravest sin and the ugliest injustice

Wisdom: سُوءُ الظَّنِّ بِمَنْ لَا يَخُونُ مِنَ اللُّؤْمِ
enWisdom: Thinking ill of one who is not disloyal stems from vileness

Wisdom: سُوءُ الظَّنِّ يُرْدِي مُصَاحِبَهُ وَيُنْجِي مُجَانِبَهُ
enWisdom: Thinking evil [of others] destroys the one who adopts it and saves the one who avoids it

Wisdom: شَرُّ النَّاسِ مَنْ لَا يَثِقُ بِأَحَدٍ لِسُوءِ ظَنِّهِ وَلَا يَثِقُ بِهِ أَحَدٌ لِسُوءِ فِعْلِهِ
enWisdom: The worst person is one who does not trust anyone because of his suspicion and who is not trusted by anyone because of his evil actions

Wisdom: لِكُلِّ إِنْسَانٍ أَرَبٌ فَابْعَدُوا عَنِ الرَّيْبِ
enWisdom: Every person has a [desire and a] need, so distance yourselves from suspicion

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاءَ ظَنُّهُ تَأَمَّلَ
enWisdom: One whose assumption [about others] is negative, scrutinizes

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاءَ ظَنُّهُ سَاءَ وَهْمُهُ
enWisdom: One who thinks ill [of others], his imagination becomes evil

Wisdom: مَنْ كَثُرَ رِيبَتُهُ كَثُرَتْ غِيبَتُهُ
enWisdom: One whose suspicion increase, his backbiting [also] increases

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاءَ ظَنُّهُ بِمَنْ لَا يَخُونُ [لَا يَخُونُهُ‏] حَسُنَ ظَنُّهُ بِمَا لَا يَكُونُ [بِمَا لَا يَخُونُهُ‏]
enWisdom: One who thinks ill of one who is not disloyal ends up thinking positively of that which is not so

Wisdom: مَنْ سَاءَتْ ظُنُونُهُ اعْتَقَدَ الْخِيَانَةَ بِمَنْ لَا يَخُونُهُ
enWisdom: One whose thoughts [about others] are negative assumes the disloyalty of the one who is not disloyal to him

Wisdom: مَنْ غَلَبَ عَلَيْهِ سُوءُ الظَّنِّ لَمْ يَتْرُكْ بَيْنَهُ وَبَيْنَ خَلِيلٍ صُلْحاً
enWisdom: One who is overcome by negative thoughts leaves no room for reconciliation between him and his friend

Wisdom: مِنَ الْبَلِيَّةِ سُوءُ الطَّوِيَّةِ
enWisdom: One of the [great] tribulations is [having] evil inner thoughts

Wisdom: مَا أَقْرَبَ الدُّنْيَا مِنَ الذَّهَابِ وَالشَّيْبَ مِنَ الشَّبَابِ وَالشَّكَّ مِنَ الِارْتِيَابِ
enWisdom: How close this world is to departure, old age is to youth, and doubt is to uncertainty!

Wisdom: وَاللَّهِ لَا يُعَذِّبُ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ مُؤْمِناً بَعْدَ الْإِيمَانِ إِلَّا بِسُوءِ ظَنِّهِ وَسُوءِ خُلُقِهِ
enWisdom: By Allah! Allah, the Glorified, will not punish a believer after he believes except because of his thinking ill [of others] and his bad character

Wisdom: لَا تَصْرِمْ أَخَاكَ عَلَى ارْتِيَابٍ وَلَا تَهْجُرْهُ بَعْدَ اسْتِعْتَابٍ
enWisdom: Do not sever ties with your brother because of some doubt that you have, and do not abandon him after he has sought [your] pardon

Wisdom: لَا تَظُنَّنَّ بِكَلِمَةٍ بَدَرَتْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ سُوءً وَأَنْتَ تَجِدُ لَهَا فِي الْخَيْرِ مُحْتَمَلًا
enWisdom: Do not think of a word that has been spoken by someone as evil while you find a possible positive meaning in it

Wisdom: لَا دِينَ لِمُسِي‏ءِ الظَّنِّ
enWisdom: The one who thinks ill [of others] has no faith

Wisdom: لَا إِيمَانَ مَعَ سُوءِ ظَنٍّ
enWisdom: There is no faith with negative thinking

Wisdom: لَا أَجْبَنَ مِنْ مُرِيبٍ
enWisdom: Nobody more timid than the suspicious one
